item.description:
This event will be a potluck meal, followed by a concise overview of three global events converging upon us and how we can engage our communities in preparing for them ahead of time.
  • Peak Oil
    (9 min video)

  • Climate Change
    (11 min video, plus the latest update on positive feedbacks)

  • The Economic Crisis
    (15 min summary: C. Martenson's Crash Course)



A very brief question and answer session will follow each video.

This summary will be followed by an overview of the Transition Model (www.transitiontowns.org), as a solution that empowers ordinary people to raise awareness and engage their communities to directly tackle these issues before they happen. By adopting and adapting the Transition Model to its local culture and economic situation, a community can unleash its collective genius to co-create a future which is energy reduced, and yet more positive and fulfilling than life at present.

Presenter: Alastair Lough, PhD

Doors open at 6:30PM for potluck. Presentation/discussion begins shortly after 7PM.

We ask people to bring your own plates, cups and utensils,
and a dish or non-alcoholic beverage to share.

A $1 donation is requested.
